name: Mailchimp modules

children.text: After connecting to the Mailchimp app, you can use the following modules to build your

data.label: Mailchimp

children.text: Select or map the Store ID whose order you want to create.
Select an option: Existing Customer or Create a New Customer
Customer ID: Select or map the Customer ID whose order you want to create.
Email Address: Enter the customer's email address.
Opt-in Status: Select whether to choose the opt-in status.
Company: Enter the customer's company name.
First Name: Enter the customer's first name.
Last Name: Enter the customer's last name.
Address: Enter the details of the address
Enter the details of the lines:
Line ID: Enter the unique identifier for the order line item.
Product ID: Select the unique identifier for the product associated with the order line item.
Product Variant I: Select the unique identifier for the product variant associated with the order line item.
Quantity: Enter the quantity of an order line item.
Price: Enter the price of an order line item.
Discount: Enter the total discount amount applied to this line item.
A unique identifier for the order.
The three-letter ISO 4217 code for the currency that the store accepts.Must be exactly 3 characters long.
A string that uniquely identifies the campaign for an order.
Select the URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop:
Select the fulfillment status for the order:
Enter the total discount amount to be applied to the price of the order.
Enter the order's Mailchimp tracking code. The possible value:"prec".
The date and time the order was processed in ISO 8601 format.
The date and time the order was canceled in ISO 8601 format.
Passing a value for this parameter will cancel the order being created.
Enter the date and time the order was updated in ISO 8601 format.
Name  	  The name associated with an order's shipping address.
Address 1  	  Enter the order's shipping address.
Address 2  	  Enter an additional field for the shipping address.
City  	  Enter the order's shipping address city.
Province  	  Enter the state or normalized province in the order's shipping address.
Province Code  	  Enter the two-letter code for the province or state in the shipping address. It must be exactly 2 characters long.
Postal Code  	  Enter the shipping address's postal or zip code.
Country  	  Enter the shipping address's country.
Country Code  	  Enter the two-letter code for the country in the shipping address.
Longitude  	  Enter the shipping address's longitude location.
Latitude  	  Enter the shipping address's latitude location.
Phone  	  Enter the phone number of the order's shipping address.
Company  	  Enter the company associated with the shipping address.
Amount Discounted  	  Enter the amount of discount applied to the total price.
Type  	  Select the type of discount
Enter the unique identifier for the outreach. Can be an email campaign ID.
Enter the tracking number associated with the order.
Enter the tracking carrier associated with the order.
Enter the tracking URL associated with the order.
Retrieves up to the previous 180 days of daily detailed aggregated activity stats for a list.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
